meanings.definition: To sit on eggs in order to keep them warm until they hatch.
meanings.sent1: The mother bird was incubating her eggs in the nest.
meanings.sent2: The hen is incubating her eggs to help them hatch.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken sit on the remote control? It thought it was incubating eggs!
meanings.sent4: The idea was incubating in his mind, waiting to hatch into a brilliant plan.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the incubating hen kept the eggs safe and cozy.

meanings.sent1: The project is incubating, taking its time to grow and evolve.
meanings.sent2: Ideas need time to incubate before they can become successful.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter seemed to be incubating in the oven, rising slowly.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for art was incubating within her, waiting for the right moment to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The friendship was incubating over many years, becoming stronger with each passing day.
